title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manger will ask you some behavioral questions, after answering them, the manager will ask flexibility in your work hours and you will here back from them after an 1 week
Interview Questions: What conflict you came across in your previous job

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: I had a 10-question interview. They gave me a sheet of paper with the questions on them. It gave me an opportunity to read the questions and then answer them
Interview Questions: What have you don't for your community recently?

title: Campus Technology Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It'd been very well. There were 4 interviewers who rotated to ask questions. About 10 questions total. Most of them are about technical questions. It took them 2 months to get me back, saying they will contact my references to know more about me
Interview Questions: what do you know about AV?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Very engaging and pleasant. Described the nature of the position. Described the culture of the organization and the opportunities available for continued growth. Discussed teaching  experiences and how those translated to the classroom for instruction.
Interview Questions: Describe teaching style  you use for instruction.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: sat with 3 people on a zoom they asked standard questions that I have heard at other interviews the reception was not veru good and it was hard to hear everything so they had to repeat
Interview Questions: when was the last time you dealt with a difficult client/student

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Self introduction, previous experience related to the job.  Friendly talk, some basic lab skills, safety questions, the compensation, and how to deal with students' conflict, questions for them. (some calculation needed. )
Interview Questions: The Steps to prepare a designated solution use volumetric flask.

title: Career Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward interview.  Asked questions related to tardiness, calling into work sick, etc.  Wanted to know background and how it would benefit position.  Was also asked for ideas on how to be successful in position.
Interview Questions: Do you frequently take time off from work?  How do you think doing this might impact co-workers?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very quick and efficient. I was called for a interview a few days after applying. I got a request for a background check a day after interviewing
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of the tutor position?

title: Enrollment Services Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was fine. They asked me 8 questions, how would you like to be managed, why would you want to work in the enrollment services, how important is the enrollment services to students?
Interview Questions: how would you like to be managed, why would you want to work in the enrollment services, how important is the enrollment services to students?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very slow. You may have to apply multiple times. Try to find the hiring manager and let them know you applied. HR gets a large number of resumes which may be overlooked.
Interview Questions: Things related to the type of work you will be doing.

title: Enrollment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: n the interview process, you already know that the candidate is generally well-qualified for the role, so it’s time to dig further into culture fit and work style. See if you can identify what motivates a candidate, what drew them to your company and how they work on a team, amongst other questions.
Interview Questions: Have you had experience with customer service?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Arrive on a different campus than the one you applied for. Sit, and have a one-on-one with the overseer of the different positions in the field of the position you applied for. General questions and qualifications. If everything goes well, you will be sent to get fingerprinted and await a background check. Which typically takes a few weeks.
Interview Questions: Do you know anyone in the program you are applying to join in?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was a bit daunting. Took a while before I heard anything back. Almost got discouraged and was about to move on before I got the call back. Patience is key with them
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience as a coordinator

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: My 1st interview was over the telephone. I was interviewed by a handful of the department faculty who then approved me to be interviewed by the Dean, Assistant Dean and Department Chair. The interview with the faculty was nerve racking because they asked questions that really didn't apply to my situation. The final interview with the Dean was awesome.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years?

title: Tutor I Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: A lot of "what-if" type of behavioral questions. I was supposed to work as a math and programming tutor, so I expected somewhat technical or mathematical questions, but it must be the case that what your transcript says matters the most.
Interview Questions: What if a student looked sad or depressed? What would you do as a tutor of the student?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: A few "what if" type of questions were asked, and the interview was fun and did not make me nervous during the interview. I would say that communication skills are still important, though.
Interview Questions: What if you saw a student who is confused about a problem in your favorite subject?

title: Faculty Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview went pretty well. Very easy, quick, and asked basic questions about my experience and how well I could perform as a tutor. For this position, you must have previous experience. Got hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: What were my previous tutoring experiences?

title: Student Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy,  straight forward, and in a calm environment. Real easy questions, even though for some reason I was a little bit nervous. But, overall very easy interview.
Interview Questions: Could you tell me a little bit about yourself?

title: Job Placement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It went smoothly with lots of smiling and chances to show off your skills. The hiring manager was nice as she asked questions that you can related to, not canned questions like those you can find all over the internet. Overall, I was happy with the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your how your day look like in your previous position. How you can handle if there are changes in the schedule?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: The interview took about 45 minutes. Pretty easy questions to be asked. Asked me if I know how to use a computer properly including Microsoft Work, Excel, etc. Asked me questions on where I saw myself in the future.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths?
Why do you want to work here?
What would I do in certain situations.

title: Tutor II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Working on the JD council was challenging. We had to examine four agenda topics: combating illicit trafficking of small arms, minimize the risk of cyber warfare, combat extremists, and prevent the usage of water as a weapon. The competition, which was held on February 17-19, 2018, was competitive. Each team was trying to produce the maximum number of resolutions. Our Joint Defense had successfully sponsored three draft resolutions and became a signatory of two other resolutions.
Interview Questions: Our Joint Defense had successfully sponsored three draft resolutions and became a signatory of two other resolutions

title: Campus Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. The Hiring manager was very nice and asked questions related to the position. They also discussed their current department needs and what they are looking for in a candidate. The overall interview was a success.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to deal with a difficult customer?

title: HR Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple.  The interviewer read a few questions off the paper but began to have more of a conversational type interview.  I got a job offer 3 days later.
Interview Questions: What motivates you to do your job?

title: Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: First round is a panel interview with behavioral questions. Then you have a second interview with the campus manager and that one is behavioral plus a little technical so be prepared.
Interview Questions: How do you handle conflict?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very friendly conversation with the program director and she explained their expectations and then asked a few “interview questions”. She was extremely satisfied with my answers. Actually I was overqualified for this position and the program director was wondering why I am interested in this job. So, she contacted all my referrals after the intervew.
Interview Questions:
1. What will you do if somebody complains about me to you?
2. What will you do if you come to me to talk about a new idea but I am busy ?

title: Enrollment Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Did take a while to get back, but once you get a call back the process goes by quickly. I recommend applying to as many jobs and keeping up with the status as well as calling or emailing the supervisors if possible.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was about 30 minutes. I was asked about prior experience, why I wanted to work there, and any other general interview questions; nothing too scary. I think what they were looking for was for professionalism more than anything.
Interview Questions:
What are you currently studying/ are you in school? 
Do you have prior experience with constituents or clients?

title: Part-time Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: I knew someone so it was an easy interview. I came in and gave my transcript and I also was able to talk a bit about the job and see where I worked
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to the workplace?

title: Testing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: the interview is about an hour long or less with one individual. Mostly they will go over moral and ethical situations and how you would deal with them. Its very casual, don't feel overwhelmed, its a great job to have if you're looking for flexibility and to learn the testing process.
Interview Questions: Its more questions about ethical dilemmas and what you would do

title: Campus Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very short and easy. People where very friendly and explain their questions very clear. They explained clearly what they where expecting in the person they decided to employ and asked what were my expectations for this role
Interview Questions: Explain a situation where you had to be a leader

title: Intensive English Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very lay back and the hiring manager was very sympathetic.  She made me feel very comfortable and was able to understand what was needed for this position.  I was surprised as this was a one on one interview and the person made sure I was aware of the process.
Interview Questions: Why did I want to work for Houston Community College?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview was quite the usual deal with the same old questions about how I would face a situation mostly STAR based questions. if you do your prep well you won't have any issues. make sure to be confident
Interview Questions: How will I deal with a student who doesn't comply to the policies?

title: Testing Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth, the hiring manager was very nice and she made sure I felt comfortable.  I could tell she cares for her employee the way she explained herself and what motivated me even more in the interview was that she also said I was going to do more roles such as on the job training in different departments.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 5 years?

title: Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straight forward.  I did a Skype interview by a panel of interviewers. The interview was very pleasant and friendly.  Panel did a great job of explaining the duties of the job.
Interview Questions: Background Experience related to the job.

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief and short, not a difficult interview. Mostly asking about training and experience. Reviews and asks questions from the resume you provided them. They have most of the information and have reviewed it before the interview.
Interview Questions: Where did you receive your training?

title: Instructional Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with service desk manager.  Interview discussed past experiences and talked about different aspects of the job and understanding about what all the job would touch on.  The interview was conducted in a more friendly discussion format instead of a more interrogation feeling questioning session.
Interview Questions: Your familiarity with learning management systems and any history in using or supporting such systems.

title: Adjunct English Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The department chair did not ask me a single question. She took the entire opportunity to talk about her and what new things she was doing in her own classes. She then showed me which books I was required to teach and sent me off.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Procurement Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 months. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very simple.  I was called in to interview one month after the closing date. The interview involved a 2 person panel and most of the questions were fairly simple.
Interview Questions: What is your preferred method of communication?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: The process for some positions is long and detailed. There are many questions to answer and many documents to submit. However, the job is good and it is worth it.
Interview Questions: None of them were difficult if you prepare yourself for the interview.

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Applied to job posting on hccsjobs.com. I met with the hiring manager for interview. She asked me some questions about my experience and skills. I asked her some questions about my duties and the mission of the department was.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Emailed the employer (a former teacher) and requested an opportunity to work with them. I had previously been invited to apply when I was a student because the teaching assistants have high turn over rate as they often are moving toward professional school.
Interview Questions: career goals, teaching experience

title: Human Resources Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is something to be desired. Questions asked are not completely relevant to the position. Poor or no follow-up with candidates. Hiring process takes 45 to 90 days per message for Peoplesoft.
Interview Questions: No difficult or unexpected questions, as a matter of fact, the interview questions are taped to the table in front of candidates seat.

title: Senior Project Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied and it took about 3 months to get the interview. They have to screen it through HR first. It was one face to face interview that wasn't hard and wasn't long.  

About 10 questions. Wasn't hard if you know your stuff.
Interview Questions: IT Cabling Standards?

title: Financial Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online application weeks later I received a phone call to come in for a panel interview. From the moment I walked into the HCC Main St. Admin office things went down hill. Several staff didn't know what room I should go to, I was sent to the 3rd floor, 6th, and to HR all WRONG places. I finally made it to the interview for a panel interview with 6 of the current financial coaches. A week later I was called and asked to come in for another interview. This interview was back at the Main St. headquarters. I interviewed with the Directors of three campuses. A week later I was told to come in for another with the president of the Northwest (Katy) campus. The interview started late and ran over. At that point I made a conscience decision that I did not want the job!
Interview Questions: The interview questions were easy. The difficult part was going to so many interviews for a job paying $35K. The disorganization, interview requests, delayed interviews, and no one being able to tell me what the salary range was so unprofessional.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Assisted with scanning, faxing, copying and printing. Answered phone calls and made requested to phone calls for counselors. Created, modified, retrieved and consolidated data using Microsoft Excel, Word, Access ad Power Point.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply for this position?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: They call you for a phone interview first. These are just general questions to get to know you a little better. If you pass, then they call you and invite you you to do a face to face interview with the manager and one other person of their selection. The setting is relaxed, and they ask you basic interview questions. Typically, you will hear news within two weeks.
Interview Questions: What are you looking for in this job?

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Went in for an interview. Very general questions about yourself. Not many questions. Mostly just informing you of the job. Accepted and started following week.
Interview Questions: When was there a time when you turn a bad situation around?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College
Interview Descriptions: Typical panel interview.
Interview Questions: Given a concept and asked to provide an  "on the spot" lecture on the topic.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Met with 5 current faculty. Had to present a brief ten minute lesson. Then answer questions about psychology and basic concepts as a test to see if I was competent
Interview Questions: They asked me to describe the different reinforcement types.

title: Public Relations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was great! The director was very clear about what he wanted in a Public Relations Assistant and I offered a variety of skills that he was impressed with. I showed him my portfolio and we discussed the hours and schedules as well as all of the job requirements. The department receptionist was very  friendly and welcoming. I was showed around the department and building. The public relations director who interviewed me also introduced me to the people I would be working with.
Interview Questions: Interviewer asked about my interests in the college.

title: Student Gorvenment President Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: First thing is to become an active member of Student Government Association and nominate yourself for a position at the end of the school year. Advisor will review all applicant and set interview date. Whoever that doesn't meet the requirement will get cutoff and remaining candidate will be elected by students votes.
Interview Questions: What qualification do you have for this position?

title: Secretary II - Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Houston Community College in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from the Dept head, telling me that she received my resume from a colleague who had recently interviewed me (for a position I didn't get). From the sound of it she had already made up her mind about hiring me and wanted only 15 minutes of my time so I can sign papers to seal the deal. My 15 minute meeting with her turned into 1.5 hours of her talking about everything under the sun. Good thing I didn't have another interview that afternoon.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Just a basic meet and greet. Met the lead in the downtown office. We talked about what I would be doing. Signed paperwork and told to be at the highschool at a time and date. They would have material for me when I get there.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with both HR and department head.  I filled out an online application, then met with HR for the main campus followed by a meeting with HR for the campus that I was to teach at.  This was followed by an interview with the department head and two other professors.  The entire process took several months.  This was mostly due to the semester schedule.  Upon being hired I had to get certified through in-house training in online lecturing.  This process took about one month
Interview Questions: What is your approach to teaching?

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview took around 10 minutes with 5 questions asking about how do you know about the job, do you know anyone work here, what time you can work and so on about your strength.
Interview Questions: Can you work with rotation schedule?

title: Test Proctor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College (Houston, TX) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Quick and simple. They are honestly looking for anyone who is willing to work. The interview itself lasted no more that 45 minutes, it was the actual hiring process that took 30 days.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?

title: Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Houston Community College in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Newly remodeled; up to date environment; unskilled and non-responsive Employment Department; Employment Director was slow to respond to questions about  culture, contract status, salary range, composition of the interview committee, presentation guidelines
Interview Questions: Please describe a conflict with co-worker or manager and how was it resolved.
